Traits.Name: Uncanny Mimicry
Traits.Content: False Humans can perfectly mimic the speech and movements of creatures they observe, gaining advantage on Deception checks against creatures that have seen them imitate someone.

Traits.Name: Unearthly Presence
Traits.Content: When a False Human comes into view, creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by it until the end of their next turn.

Actions.Name: Multiattack
Actions.Content: The False Human makes two attacks: one with its False Embrace and one with its Echoing Strike.

Actions.Name: False Embrace
Actions.Content: Melee Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) psychic damage, plus 3 (1d6) necrotic damage, as the False Human envelops the target in a chilling aura that draws from their very essence.

Actions.Name: Echoing Strike
Actions.Content: Melee Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d6 + 4 + 2d6) psychic damage, as the False Human mimics the voice of someone the target loves, causing emotional distress. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened until the end of their next turn.

Actions.Name: Distorted Reflection
Actions.Content: The False Human targets one creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or become incapacitated as they are momentarily lost in a vision of a perfect replica of themselves. If they fail this save, they take 27 (6d8) psychic damage. This ability can be used once per long rest.
